{{Infobox soap character 2| |series=Emmerdale |image=[[File:Lisa Dingle.png|200px]] |caption= Lisa in 2009. |name=Lisa Dingle |portrayer=[[Jane Cox]] |born=18 February 1956http://www.tv3.ie/shows.php?request=emmerdale |death= |years=1996â |occupation= Factory Worker/Art Model |home=Wishing Well Cottage |husband = Barry Clegg (1977â98)
[[Zak Dingle]] (1998â) |daughters = [[Belle Dingle]]| |classification=[[List of characters from Emmerdale#Present characters|Present; regular]] |spinoffs= ''The Dingles Down Under (1997)
Emmerdale: The Dingles
For Richer for Poorer (2010) |creator=Mervyn Watson |first= 13 August 1996 |last= }} '''Lisa May Dingle''' (previously '''Clegg''') is a [[fictional character]] in the [[United Kingdom|British]] [[soap opera]] ''[[Emmerdale]]'' played by [[Jane Cox]]. ==Creation== ===Casting=== Lisa Clegg was first introduced by producer Mervyn Watson in 1996 who cast [[Jane Cox]] for the role. Lisa first appeared in August 1996, as a potential love interest for [[Zak Dingle]] ([[Steve Halliwell]]) after his wife [[Nellie Dingle]] ([[Sandra Gough]]) left to care for her father in [[Ireland]]. Jane Cox really enjoyed the chance to play Lisa Clegg. In an interview shortly after landing the role of Lisa, Cox stated [...] 'I was told that Lisa was a big lady and most comfortable in wellington boots [...] . Jane Cox had originally auditioned for the role of Nellie Dingle. However Mervyn Watson gave the role to Sandra Gough, Cox was pleased she got the part of Lisa Clegg instead because she really enjoyed the character. [...] She's very practical and down to earth. I like the fact that she spends most of the time in a boiler suit but can be sassy.[...] {{citenews|url=http://www.emmerdale.org/emmerdale/dingles/lisa.htm|title=Emmerdale's Lisa Dingle|publisher=Emmerdale Org|author=Emmerdale Org|date=16 September 2003|accessdate=2010-05-09}} ==Storylines== ===1996â=== When Lisa Clegg met [[Zak Dingle]], she was instantly smitten. While other women may have been turned off by Zakâs dodgy dealing and oddball family, Lisa didnât care about any of it. However, the path of true love didnât run smoothly for the couple - especially when Lisaâs ex-husband, Barry, turned up and tried to blow up the Dingle homestead. Despite their problems, Zak and Lisa married on January 28, 1998. Family troubles kept them busy during that year, but Zak and Lisa were about to get a Christmas present theyâd never forget. On Christmas Day 1998, Lisa went into the barn to check on the animals and delivered a baby she had no idea she was expecting! The arrival of baby [[Belle Dingle|Belle]] served to deepen Zak and Lisaâs marriage, even surviving the nightmare that was Zakâs ex-wife Nellieâs stay in the village. Lisa was deeply saddened when Zakâs son [[Butch Dingle|Butch]] was killed in a bus crash in the village. She even moved out when it was clear Zak blamed her as sheâd fixed the brakes on the vehicle before it crashed. After a few months, Zak realised he couldnât live without Lisa and begged her to move back in. In 2001, tragedy hit again when Zak was diagnosed with testicular cancer. Zak overcame the disease with Lisa's love and support and repaid his wife by inviting his mother Peg to move in. With Peg around, tensions in the Dingle household reached fever pitch. When she went, everyone was relieved. The family was split again when Zak went off to South America in 2002 in search of the Dingle treasure - without Lisaâs blessing. With her husband away, Lisa felt vulnerable - especially with Zakâs sleazy brother, Shadrach, coming on to her all the time. In the end, Lisa resorted to violent tactics to make Shadrach back off and was relieved he got the message. Although she enjoyed a few dates with [[Bob Hope (Emmerdale)|Bob Hope]]âs brother Eddie, it was clear that Zak was still the man for Lisa - a fact confirmed by his return and their subsequent reunion. If Lisa and Zak thought life would be simpler now they were older, they were wrong. They were shocked to discover that Debbie had had a baby as no one knew she was pregnant. Lisa felt sheâd let Debbie down and was determined to give her all the support she needed to bring up baby [[Sarah Dingle|Sarah]]. Unfortunately, Debbie couldnât cope with being a mum. She did everything she could to avoid looking after her daughter which infuriated Lisa, causing many rows and this left the Dingle matriarch at the end of her tether. So when Debbie gave baby Sarah to [[Emily Kirk]], who then disappeared, Lisa hit the roof. Unable to bear the sight of Debbie, she wasn't sorry to see her leave. Meanwhile, more tragedy was to hit the family when Zakâs son, Sam, announced his girlfriend [[Alice Wilson]] was pregnant â only for that news to be followed by the revelation that Alice had cancer. Lisa proved to be the backbone of the family as everyone tried to prepare Sam for Aliceâs death and looking after their baby son, Samson, alone. The morning of the competition in Emmerdale's 5000th episode, Lisa accidentally knocked out Val carrying a big bag of linens. Lisa and Val had been feuding and Lisa worried Val might have it out for her. Eli Dingle tied and gagged Val whilst Lisa was gone, intending to ransom her. Val was fuming at the Dingles until Lisa accidentally let it slip that Eric was planning the wedding for that day. There were a few hiccups but Val and Eric did get married and have lived happily together since. Lisa was relieved when Belle's time at private school came to an end. She went there initially because [[Rosemary King]] realised how intelligent Belle was and offered to pay the fees. Anything else - from the uniform to school trips - were to be funded by the Dingles. Unfortunately when Rosemary left the village, she stopped paying the fees and it was a struggle for Zak and Lisa to pay them. They borrowed a lot of money from Debbie, leading her to get into trouble with Carl, who she borrowed the money from. After Zak quit his job at Home Farm, following a row over breakages Matthew insisted Zak pay for, Belle's friends found out that Zak hadn't paid the fees and teased her about it. So, recognising the problem, Zak and Lisa removed her from that school and she has returned to the local primary school. Lisa has also managed to create a bond between Debbie and her daughter, Sarah. Andy agreed to let the Dingles see Sarah regularly and by getting Debbie to visit at the same time as Sarah and play with her, a mother-daughter bond is starting to develop. Sarah thinks Jo is her mum but enjoys spending time with Debbie. Lisa has also met [[Olena Petrovich]] and has learnt to love her.She is also sensing that Sam is growing to love Olena. Towards Christmas 2009, Lisa started nude modelling as the Dingles needed the extra cash for Christmas in order to buy Belle a laptop and put other presents under the tree. When Lisa told Zak how tight fisted she thought Nikhil is, Zak grew suspicious as Lisa had said the money for Belle's laptop came from a works bonus. Lisa was forced to tell Zak the truth. He initially wasn't happy she kept it from him, but he came round. When Eli and Shadrach found out, they kept making wisecracks so Lisa decided to stop due to the lack of support from people round her, after admitting to Zak that she felt good about herself. In 2010, Lisa was arrested for punching a policeman annd was sentenced to three months in jail. In 2010, a man named [[Derek Benrose]] began working at the Sharma Sweet Factory in Emmerdale, alongside Lisa. They began a close friendship, and Zak got on with Derek too. He seemed a friendly enough guy, and most people liked him. On Thursday 6th January 2011, Derek took a dark turn, and when he and Lisa were alone in the factory, he raped her. Lisa faced further heartache, in March when the police said they didn't have enough evidence to pursue the crime. ==Reception== Cox was nominated in the category of "Best Actress" at the 2011 [[British Soap Awards]].{{cite news|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/soaps/scoop/a307476/british-soap-awards-2011-voting-opens.html|title=British Soap Awards 2011 voting opens|last=Kilkelly|first=Daniel|date=7 March 2011|work=[[Digital Spy]]|publisher=[[Hachette Filipacchi UK]]|accessdate=2011-03-07}} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.itv.com/page.asp?partid=3678 Lisa Dingle] at [[itv.com]] {{Emmerdale}} {{Emmerdale characters}} {{EDDingles}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Dingle, Lisa}} [[Category:Emmerdale characters]] [[Category:Fictional characters introduced in 1996]] [[Category:Fictional farmers]] [[Category:Fictional factory workers]] [[Category:Fictional machinists]] [[Category:Fictional mechanics]] [[Category:Fictional models]] [[Category:Fictional taxicab drivers]]
